sections.title: Muon force
items: Muon force is the force caused by the muon properties of bosons.
here is the muon constant, W is muon number and d is distance (in pixels).

sections.title: Touch force
items: Touch force is the force that helps keep the bosons away from each other.
here is the touch constant and d is distance (in pixels).

sections.title: Net force
items: Net force is how much the bosons will repel. If the value is negative, bosons attract.
Net force can be calculated by summing muon and touch forces.

sections.title: Resting distance
items: The balance distance of two bosons is called resting distance, which can be found using net force.
R must be found to calculate standard enthalpy.
For perfect molecules, R can be calculated easily.

title: /constants.r_N
constant
items: constant is defined as the resting distance of bosons in first degree dimers.
, perfect resting distance formula can be used.

sections.title: Ru unit
items: Fnet can be recalculated for the ru unit using d = x
